Mystery Signals Mystery Signals Mystery Signals

SIGNAL 07 — 1993-11-14 — 02:41 AM
SIGNAL 11 — 1995-03-02 — 03:17 AM

Fourteen tapes contain signals we cannot explain. The interference started in 1993 and stopped in 1997. Always between 2 AM and 4 AM. Always on Channel 12. The FCC said it was equipment malfunction. The equipment was unplugged for three of those recordings. If you recognize the pattern, tell us.

Lost & Found

Harlan County Telethon
1994 — Frame 11:42

Trying to identify the woman selling chess pies at the 1994 Harlan County telethon. She appears at 11:42, 34:08, and 1:02:17. Wears a blue apron. Somebody's grandmother knew everybody's name but nobody wrote down hers.

"She's in seven tapes across three years. Always pies. Always chess pies. — Agnes"

Dusty Data

ELDON ADVERTISER
Vol. 47, No. 12
March 1991

User @microfiche_ruth submitted a scan of the Eldon Advertiser, March 1991. Page 4 lists the Channel 12 broadcast schedule. The lunch menu readings are listed as "Community Programming" with no host name. Forty-seven episodes. No credit.

"He didn't want credit. He wanted someone to know it was Salisbury steak day. — Dale"
